key_title: Key to the species of Galium

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Rubiaceae

source.author: Thompson, I.R.
source.title: A revision of Asperula and Galium (Rubieae: Rubiaceae) in Australia
source.citation: From: Thompson, I.R. (2009). A revision of Asperula and Galium (Rubieae: Rubiaceae) in Australia. Muelleria 27:36-112.

leads.lead_text: Leaves and stipules predominantly in whorls of 5–12; introduced annuals or perennials
Leaves and stipules maximally in whorls of 4 (very rarely 1 or a few whorls with more parts)
Mericarps cylindrical; corolla lobes less than half length of ovary
Mericarps somewhat ellipsoid, globose or depressed-globose; corolla-lobes greater than half length of ovary
Corolla-lobes greater than 1 mm long, longer than ovary; stem angles and leaf margins lacking robust retrorsely curved hairs
Corolla-lobes up to 1 mm long and/or shorter than ovary, if ever more than 1 mm long then stem-angles and leaf margins bearing a line of robust retrorsely curved hairs
Corolla white; leaves linear to oblanceolate with flat or slightly recurved margins; plants not stoloniferous
Corolla yellow; leaves linear with tightly revolute margins; plants stoloniferous
Inflorescences not subtended by a leaf; corolla lobes less than half length of ovary; mericarps more than twice as long as broad
Inflorescences subtended by a leaf; corolla lobes greater than half length of ovary; mericarps less than twicce as long as broad
Mericarps less than 1 mm long; margin of leaves with antrorse-appressed hairs; panicles arising from stems commonly bearing more than 10 flowers
Mericarps greater than 1 mm long; margin of leaves with robust retrorsely curved spine-like hairs; inflorescences arising from stems bearing 1–6(–10) flowers
Ovaries and fruit tuberculate, with hairs absent or minute, not hooked; upper surface of leaves with a line of antrorse hairs in distal third near margin but otherwise glabrous
Ovaries and fruit with tubercle-based hairs greater than 0.3 mm long, apically hooked; upper surface of leaves glabrous or if hairy then not distributed as above
Corolla-lobes c. 0.8 mm long, cream to white; bracts commonly 2 or more at lowest node of inflorescence; mericarps 2–4 mm long; whorls usually of a maximum of 7 or 8
Corolla-lobes c. 0.5 mm long, greenish-cream; bracts commonly 1 or absent at lowest node of inflorescence; mericarps 1.2–2.3 mm long; whorls usually of a maximum of 6
Corolla snow-white adaxially, with lobes at least twice length of ovary
Corolla pale yellow, cream, dull-white, greenish or purplish adaxially, usually with lobes less than twice length of ovary
Inflorescences not subtended by a leaf; corolla-lobes less than half length of ovary; mericarps greater than twice as long as broad
Inflorescences subtended by a leaf; corolla-lobes greater than half length of ovary; mericarps less than twice as long as broad
Fruit with spreading hairs regularly hooked at the very tip and extending 0.3 mm or more out from surface (hairs somewhat antrorse-appressed early in flowering)
Fruit glabrous or hairs not entirely as above
Longest branch or pedicel in an inflorescence greater than 5 mm long, becoming curved to hooked c. 1 mm below summit post-flowering;  fruit with hairs at least 0.5 mm long
Longest branch or pedicel in an inflorescence less than 5 mm long, remaining straight; fruit with hairs up to 0.5 mm long
Leaves, stipules and bracts lacking glandular cells, leaves distinctly petiolate; mericarps longitudinally rugose
Leaves, stipules and bracts in inflorescences developing glandular cells, leaves ± sessile; mericarps not rugose or rugae reticulate
Whorls on main stem below inflorescences with stipules less than half length of leaves; corolla to 1.6 mm diam.
Whorls on main stem below inflorescences with stipules more than half length of leaves; corolla diameter various, up to 4 mm diam.

Corolla c. 1–1.5 mm diam.; inflorescences mostly 4- or more-flowered and exceeding whorls; mericarps slightly bullate, c. 1 mm diam.; bracts present at all inflorescence-nodes and often developed on pedicels
Corolla greater than 1.5 mm diam. or if not then not with the above combination of characters
Fruit with scattered pustules that usually mature into rounded or triangular protuberances
Fruit glabrous or with short antrorse hairs sub-appressed to extending 0.1–0.2 mm beyond surface
Fruit with antrorse hairs
Fruit glabrous
Corolla 1–1.5 mm diam., lobes 0.5–0.7 mm long; mericarps 0.8–1.1 mm long, c. 0.6 mm wide
Corolla 1.5–2.6 mm diam, lobes 0.7–1.2 mm long; mericarps (1.1–)1.3–1.8 mm long, 0.7–1.2 mm wide
Terminal inflorescences exceeding whorl by several times the length of the whorl
Terminal inflorescences not or hardly exceeding whorl

Leaves narrowing fairly abruptly into petiole-like portion; stipules remaining more than two thirds of leaf length in inflorescences; ovaries and developing fruit often obovate in face view, often drying light to mid green

Leaves narrowing gradually into petiole-like portion; stipules reducing to up to half of leaf length (sometimes absent) in inflorescences; ovaries and developing fruit not obovate in face view, mostly drying olive-brown, brown or reddish-brown
Corolla 0.8–1 mm diam.; pedicels at flowering all less than 1 mm long (annuals of drier inland regions)
Corolla 1.2–4 mm diam., or if ever c. 1 mm diam. then at least some pedicels greater than 1 mm long
Leaves cuneate to broad-cuneate at base, narrowing fairly abruptly into petiole-like region; ovaries commonly obovate in face view, mostly drying light to mid green
Leaves narrow-cuneate or attenuate at base, narrowing gradually into petiole-like region, sometimes leaves hardly narrowing; ovary not obovate in face view, drying olive-brown, brown or reddish-brown
Internodes mostly 3–8 mm long, never c. 20 mm or longer (limestone areas of South Australia and coastal Victoria)
Internodes mostly 12–20 mm long, with at least some internodes c. 20 mm or longer
Corolla-lobes 0.8–1.8 mm long, clearly longer than ovary (before post-fertilisation enlargement of ovary)
Corolla-lobes 0.5–0.8 mm long, not or hardly longer than ovary
Lower leaf surface of leaves and stipules with hairs on midrib; inflorescences with flowers generally closely bunched
Lower leaf surface of leaves and stipules with glabrous midrib; at least lower inflorescences with flowers somewhat separated
